intro: Boehmeria rubrinervia, commonly known as the red-veined flax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fibrous stems are valued for their textile potential, similar to other members of the Boehmeria genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
